intro: [WRONG START] Codia bullata var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cordia, is a species native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a small, deciduous shrub or tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, often dispersed by wind. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
